qa_pairs.question: What was the timeline of Tsovinar Vardanyan's professional roles before entering politics, and how did they transition into her political career?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Tsovinar Vardanyan was born in 1980 in Yerevan, Soviet Armenia, and studied economics at Yerevan State University, graduating with a BSc in 2001 and an MSc in 2003. While pursuing her Masters, she worked at the Central Bank of Armenia between 2002 and 2003.<cite>[S4][S5][S6]</cite></statement> <statement>From 2006 to 2014, she worked in financial institutions, followed by executive leadership roles in Armenian companies from 2014 to 2019. These roles likely provided her with the expertise that transitioned her into politics.<cite>[S7]</cite></statement> <statement>Vardanyan entered politics in 2018, becoming a member of the National Assembly of Armenia as part of the Civil Contract. She was re-elected in 2021 after being announced as a candidate for the My Step alliance.<cite>[S2][S8][S9]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] Tsovinar Vardanyan


# Tsovinar Vardanyan



**Tsovinar Vardanyan** (born 8 September 1980) is an Armenian economist and politician of the Civil Contract. [S2] Since 2018 she is a member of the National Assembly of Armenia. [S3] ## Early life and education

Tsovinar Vardanyan was born in 1980 in Yerevan, Soviet Armenia. [S4] She studied economy at the Yerevan State University from where she graduated with a BSc in 2001 and an MSc in 2003. [S5] While studying for her Masters, she was employed in different positions of the Central Bank of Armenia between 2002 and 2003. [S6] ## Professional career

Between 2006 and 2014 she worked in financial institutions and between 2014 and 2019 she was in the executive leadership of several companies in Armenia. [S7] ## Political career

She was elected a Member of Parliament in the parliamentary elections of December 2018 for the Civil Contract within the My Step Alliance. [S8] In May 2021, she was announced as a candidate for the My Step alliance and was re-elected in the snap parliamentary elections of June 2021. [S9] ### Political positions

She was a leading force behind the introduction of paternal leave in Armenia in January 2021.

[S1] Tsovinar Vardanyan

Then, the Professional career section says she worked in financial institutions from 2006-2014 and then in executive leadership roles from 2014-2019. So her professional roles before politics were in financial institutions and then executive positions in companies.

Her political career began in 2018 when she became a member of the National Assembly. She was elected in December 2018 as part of the Civil Contract.
